channel.title: [FIXED]Weird mouse acceleration-like/lag-like skipping
channel.description:
So, once I started up a game i got into the intro cinematic. Then, when the train sequence commenced, I looked around a bit and then noticed that I got this very odd mouse lag. I've tried looking up over the internet, everything I found was not helpful for me. I tried: limiting fps to around 58 m_customaccel 0, 1, 1.5 and 2 reinstalling my mouse drivers restarting my pc putting in these launch commands: -useforcedmparms -noforcemaccel -noforcemspd turning v-sync and mouse smoothing on and off lowering graphical settings changing sensitivity sellecting all cores except one in task menager
However, none of those "fixes" worked. NOTE: during some moments, my mouse sensitivity would either raise or lower, it's pretty random. And the skipping often came when I turned right with my mouse (even though it could skip every now and then). I also think it might be a problem with raw input, however I can't enable it, there's no command for it)
GPU: AMD Sapphire R9 270X Dual-X CPU: AMD FX 4300 Quad-core 3.80 GHz RAM: 2x4 GB (8GB) Windows 8.1 64-bit operating system.
I FIXED IT: I only had to download the Patch for Windows 8.1 called KB2908279 (it's made for problems like these)
